laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased nuchal translucency (3.1 mm) and increased nuchal fold thickness (5.3 mm).

Bilateral short femur length (1.55 cm), tibia (1.28 cm), humerus (1.39 cm), radius (1.56 cm), and ulna (1.59 cm) all greater than 4 SD below the mean. Abdominal circumference was 12.2 cm, head circumference was 17.2 cm, FL/AC ratio was 0.127.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Showed progression from 14 weeks GA where long bones were not specified as short.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Confirmed short limbed fetus with slightly bowed long bones in lower limbs and short long bones in upper limbs; both elbow joints were deformed with poor outline of distal humerus.

Confirmed short long bones (< 4 SD) with symmetrical involvement of proximal, middle, and distal bones. Both distal humeri were deformed with a broad proximal end. Clavicles appeared thick with an abrupt angle. No fractures were noted.
Identified a homozygous 2 bp duplication in exon 2 of the IMPAD1 gene (c.473_474dup; p.(Thr159*)).
Hematoxylinâ€“eosin staining showed focal cystic degenerative changes and separation of chondroblastic columns. Alcian blue staining revealed reduced sulfated glycosaminoglycans.
